text: Hi guys,
How to set up timeout for transaction?
hi, with latest master code, there’s error msg with `make peer`

$ make peer
mkdir -p build/image/ccenv/payload
cp build/docker/gotools/bin/protoc-gen-go build/bin/chaintool build/goshim.tar.bz2 build/image/ccenv/payload

make: *** [build/image/ccenv/payload] Error 1
I run `make gotools`, but not affect the  `build/docker/gotools/bin/` path
Thanks for any hint!
ask in <#C0YQ1NHGD|fabric-dev-env>
sure, thanks yacov
Are there any Fabric commands to reset the network and clear the data? I'm looking for a way to clear my test environment easily in between test runs
<@U36UDC6RK|kamo> has joined the channel

<@U0KPFAZNF> i cloned the current master branch, successfully run make in the fabric-baseimage folder and got the following error while running “make native” in the /github/hyperledger/fabric folder.. (Using OS X)
<@U36UDC6RK|kamo> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/kamo/F3FUNFP1V/-.yaml|Untitled>

file.name: -.yaml
file.title: Untitled

text: im sure its a pretty stupid mistake :confused:
<@U3G0PLPQW|raj> has joined the channel
<@U0Z81GL6S|anya> has left the channel
<@U3D45J2FK> Good point -- me too
<@U2X9KDDL7> docker-compose -f myfile.yaml down
or delete docker containers and reload
<@U3D45J2FK> Ah, yeah, that works, but I thought you meant a way to tell the peers to wipe their state while they're still running :slightly_smiling_face:

It would be a useful dev function -- reset state without needing to worry about docker containers, say if you want to provide a "reset demo" feature for a demo web app without requiring the user to issue commands in a shell.
<@U2X9KDDL7> that's originally what I was looking for, I've yet to find such a magic bullet haha
would be nice to have
